Advanced/1 Connection Status.title: Connection Status
Advanced/1 Connection Status.description: CometChat SDK provides you with a mechanism to get real-time status of the connection to CometChat web-socket servers.

Advanced/index.title: Advanced
Advanced/index.description: This section helps you to know about the Connection Listeners.

Authentication/1 Login Listener.title: Login Listener
Authentication/1 Login Listener.description: The CometChat SDK provides you with real-time updates for the login and logout events. This can be achieved using the LoginListener class provided. LoginListener consists of 4 events that can be triggered. These are as follows:

Bots.title: Bots
Bots.description: Bots are special users, in CometChat, who can send and receive messages autonomously. Users can text bots privately in one-on-one conversations as well as in groups. When a bot receives a message, either in a one-on-one conversation or in a group conversation, CometChat forwards the message to a Callback URL that you specify. Once you receive this message, you can send a reply using our API.

Calling/1 Direct Calling.title: Direct Calling
Calling/1 Direct Calling.description: This section will guide you to start the call/conference directly with the session id of your choice. The session id is the most important parameter as all the users joining the same session id will be connected to the same call/conference.

Calling/2 Default Calling.title: Default Calling
Calling/2 Default Calling.description: This section will provide information on how a complete calling workflow can be set up using CometChat. We've built the complete workflow to help your users make calls, receive calls as well as accept/reject calls.

Calling/3 Custom CSS.title: Custom CSS
Calling/3 Custom CSS.description: Custom CSS helps you to customize the call screen of CometChat which comes with default settings.

Calling/4 Recording (Beta).title: Recording (Beta)
Calling/4 Recording (Beta).description: This section will guide you to implement call recording feature for the voice and video calls.

Calling/index.title: Calling
Calling/index.description: Calling is a core feature of CometChat. CometChat allows two mechanisms for calling

Groups/11 Transfer Group Ownership.title: Transfer Group Ownership
Groups/11 Transfer Group Ownership.description: In other words, as a logged-in user, how do I transfer the ownership of any group if I am the owner of the group?

Groups/index.title: Groups
Groups/index.description: Groups help your users to converse together in a single space. You can have three types of groups- private, public and password protected.

Messaging/1 Send a Message.title: Send a Message
Messaging/1 Send a Message.description: Using CometChat, you can send three types of messages:

Messaging/2 Receive Messages.description: Receiving messages with CometChat has two parts:

Messaging/3 Additional Message Filtering.title: Additional Message Filtering
Messaging/3 Additional Message Filtering.description: The MessagesRequest class as you must be familiar with helps you to fetch messages based on the various parameters provided to it. This document will help you understand better the various options that are available using the MessagesRequest class.

Messaging/4 Retrieve Conversations.title: Retrieve Conversations
Messaging/4 Retrieve Conversations.description: Conversations provide the last messages for every one-on-one and group conversation the logged-in user is a part of. This makes it easy for you to build a Recent Chats list.

Messaging/5 Threaded Messages.title: Threaded Messages
Messaging/5 Threaded Messages.description: Messages that are started from a particular message are called Threaded messages or simply threads.

Messaging/6 Edit a Message.title: Edit a Message
Messaging/6 Edit a Message.description: While editing a message is straightforward, receiving events for edited messages with CometChat has two parts:

Messaging/7 Delete a Message.description: While deleting a message is straightforward, receiving events for deleted messages with CometChat has two parts:

Messaging/8 Delete a Conversation.title: Delete a Conversation
Messaging/8 Delete a Conversation.description: In case you want to delete a conversation, you can use the deleteConversation() method.

Messaging/index.title: Messaging
Messaging/index.description: Messaging is one of the core features of CometChat. We've thoughtfully created methods to help you send, receive and fetch message history.

Overview/2 Message structure and hierarc.description: The below diagram helps you better understand the various message categories and types that a CometChat message can belong to.

Overview/index.title: Overview
Overview/index.description: This guide demonstrates how to add chat to a Javascript application using CometChat. Before you begin, we strongly recommend you read the Key Concepts guide.

Resources/2 Upgrading from v1.title: Upgrading from v1
Resources/2 Upgrading from v1.description: Upgrading from v1.x to v2 is fairly simple. Below are the major changes that are released as a part of CometChat Pro v2:

Resources/index.title: Resources
Resources/index.description: We have a number of resources that will help you while integrating CometChat in your app.

User Presence.title: User Presence
User Presence.description: User Presence helps us understand if a user is available to chat or not.

Users/2 User Management.title: User Management
Users/2 User Management.description: When a user logs into your app, you need to programmatically login the user into CometChat. But before you log in the user to CometChat, you need to create the user.

Users/index.title: Users
Users/index.description: The primary aim for our Users functionality is to allow you to quickly retrieve and add users to CometChat.

Webhooks.title: Webhooks
Webhooks.description: CometChat can send webhook events that notify your application any time an event happens on your account.
